response.raw:
Here is my response formatted as requested:

<OUTPUT_TEXT>

# Preparing Affidavits and Legal Documents

1. Affidavit Preparation
   - Gather relevant facts and information from client or attorney
   - Draft affidavit using proper legal language and format
   - Include necessary components: title, statement of identity, oath, facts, signature block
   - Review draft with attorney and make any required revisions
   - Arrange for notarization of final affidavit

2. Legal Correspondence
   - Compose letters, emails, and other correspondence as directed
   - Use appropriate legal terminology and formal language
   - Proofread all documents for accuracy and clarity
   - Obtain attorney approval before sending

3. Document Organization
   - Create logical filing system for both paper and electronic documents
   - Implement consistent naming conventions for electronic files
   - Scan paper documents and save electronic copies when appropriate
   - Organize documents by case, client, or other relevant categories

4. File Maintenance
   - Regularly update and maintain both paper and electronic files
   - Ensure all documents are properly labeled and easy to locate
   - Implement retention schedules and securely dispose of outdated materials
   - Back up electronic files regularly to prevent data loss

5. Quality Control
   - Double-check all documents for accuracy, completeness, and proper formatting
   - Ensure all necessary signatures and notarizations are obtained
   - Verify that all documents are filed in their proper location
   - Conduct periodic audits of the filing system to maintain organization

</OUTPUT_TEXT>
response.extracted:
<OUTPUT_TEXT>
# Preparing Affidavits and Legal Documents

1. Affidavit Preparation
   - Gather relevant facts and information from client or attorney
   - Draft affidavit using proper legal language and format
   - Include necessary components: title, statement of identity, oath, facts, signature block
   - Review draft with attorney and make any required revisions
   - Arrange for notarization of final affidavit

2. Legal Correspondence
   - Compose letters, emails, and other correspondence as directed
   - Use appropriate legal terminology and formal language
   - Proofread all documents for accuracy and clarity
   - Obtain attorney approval before sending

3. Document Organization
   - Create logical filing system for both paper and electronic documents
   - Implement consistent naming conventions for electronic files
   - Scan paper documents and save electronic copies when appropriate
   - Organize documents by case, client, or other relevant categories

4. File Maintenance
   - Regularly update and maintain both paper and electronic files
   - Ensure all documents are properly labeled and easy to locate
   - Implement retention schedules and securely dispose of outdated materials
   - Back up electronic files regularly to prevent data loss

5. Quality Control
   - Double-check all documents for accuracy, completeness, and proper formatting
   - Ensure all necessary signatures and notarizations are obtained
   - Verify that all documents are filed in their proper location
   - Conduct periodic audits of the filing system to maintain organization
</OUTPUT_TEXT>
